name: Eosinophilic Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis (EGPA) - Allergic Variant
chief_complaint: I keep getting asthma attacks, rashes, and my hands and feet feel numb sometimes
prognosis: Variable; depends on organ involvement. With treatment, 5-year survival >80%, but relapses common
description: A rare systemic vasculitis characterized by asthma, eosinophilia, and necrotizing vasculitis affecting small-to-medium vessels. The allergic variant presents with prominent atopic features and higher IgE levels compared to classic EGPA.
risk_factors: History of atopy or allergic diseases
